title: Poster, "Ind'fence", 1990
medium: Offset lithograph on white wove paper
inscribed:
Imprinted in black along right side: rick valicenti. au [ underlined] august 2.90 at 7:30
At center right: Herbst Theater, War Memorial Building / Located at Van Ness and McAllister, San Francisco / For ticket information please call 415.552.3656
At upper right: The San Francisco Museum of Modern Art 1990 Design Lecture Series / Presented by the San Francisco Chapter of the American Institute of Graphic Arts / and the American Societyof Interior Designers

Verso: Imprinted in alternating green and white along left edge reading from lower left to upper left:General Rick Valicenti (3st) / Exposure Corinne Pfister (est) / Coiffeur Mark Stein / Camouflage Vicki Vacca / Darling Dwight Doodle Jason / Kitty Cage  Michael Pappas / MacManiac  Mouli Marur / The 1990 SFMMA Design Lecture Series / has been made possible by the generous / support of the following companies: Color Graphics / Simpson Paper Company / Williams Lithography / Aldus Corporation / San Francisco Mart / Metropolitan Furniture Corporation / The NEw Lab / Exhibit Group of San Francisco / Design & Type / Arch / Thomas Swann Signs / Repromedia / Post MArk / Iris Photographic Slides Services / Omnicomp / Il Fornaio Gastronomia Italiana / Walker Graphics / University Art Center, Palo Alto / SF Magazine.
Imprinted upper left: Oops! We almost forgot tomention: / Seps & Film Balzer / Shoppes / Printing Color Graphics / Paper Simpson Paper Co.

At right along edge: dates and location of series.
In green lower right corner: Rick Valicenti is a self-taught graphic designer. Though he has been a designer since 1978, it was only 2 1/2 years ago that Valicenti decided to follow his heart instead of just the rules. Total anarchy? Certainly not. Not / from a suburban father of 2, married for 17 years! Rather, he is a mild-mannered madman in sheep's clothing / orbiting pop culture's magnetic pull. Valicenti hopes that Thirst's energies will be successful in achieving / self-expression without overpowering the communication intent. See Valicenti 4 yorself . hee wil b nervus.
provenance: From the collection of Dan Friedman
description:
Color photographic reproduction of an image of a woman staring at the viewer. Over her head and resting on her shoudlers is a cage-like construction with a metal handle. A green linear form of a man's head encircles the image. Small blue circles with arrows projecting left suggest eyes and line of vision. Across image in white and red: ind'fence / ov.hoo.i.m. A red band with black text runs length of sheet along right side. A small, pixalated yellow number "3" is at left center on edge.
Verso: Imprinted in light green and white: Photographic enlargement, showing BenDay dot pattern of a smiling woman's face at center with portions of the hair and face over drawn. A comic strip ballon projects from a mouth with the words: ind'fence / engst.ba9.dzyn
Below image text reads "President Dwight D. Eisenhower  celebratd his 66th birthday / with a cake that made it into / the newspapers. Along left edge alternating green and white blocks form a border.

tombstone.epitaph: Poster, "Ind'fence", 1990. Offset lithograph on white wove paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-285.
